intro: Pavetta brachycoryne, commonly known as the narrow-corned pavetta, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. Pavetta brachycoryne is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
